summary: This document is a series of text message exchanges between staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, discussing staffing shortages and operational issues on August 4, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death. The messages reference 'vacated' posts and modified status, indicating heightened activity or disruption, with one message explicitly noting 'Not only due to Epstein but one of the reasons.'

events.title: MCC Staffing and Operational Issues
events.description: Text messages among Metropolitan Correctional Center staff discuss significant staffing shortages ('13 vacant posts'), a 'modified status', vacated housing units, and the potential cancellation of religious services. One message links the situation partly to Epstein.

events.title: Designated Acting Captain Coverage
events.description: A notice indicates that a staff member (name redacted) will be acting as Captain in the absence of the regular Captain on August 5th and 6th.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.context: Federal jail in Manhattan where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died.

keyFacts: The messages are dated August 4, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC cell.
Staff discuss a 'ghost town' environment with '13 vacant posts' and specific housing units (SHU 3 and 4, 5 south, 7 south) being 'vacated'.
The facility was on a 'modified status' involving a 'Staff search' and was conducting attorney visits but considering canceling religious services.
One message explicitly states the operational issues are 'Not only due to Epstein but one of the reasons,' directly linking the disruption to his case.
All staff names in the correspondence are redacted, indicated by blank spaces or single quotes in the text.
